summary: IRS estimates that in 2016 criminals used false identities to try to claim billions in tax refunds. IRS kept $10.5 billion out of their hands, but criminals got at least $1.6 billion. To help address this high risk issue, IRS works to verify the identities of millions of taxpayers each year. We reviewed IRS’s taxpayer authentication efforts and made 11 recommendations to help IRS stay...
title: Identity Theft: IRS Needs to Strengthen Taxpayer Authentication Efforts
